result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Petersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
IF REVOKED: Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of Probation at any point after 2 years, if all conditions are met and Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drugs screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Not to use or possess of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drug must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
All prescriptions need to be filled at the same pharmacy.
All treating physicians are to be informed of these charges.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Provide DNA Sample if not previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Comply with any family court orders.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: CONDITION TIME - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Character letter filed

8:37 AM Defendant Ryan M Petersen in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Ryan M Petersen. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy with Defendant and finds them guilty of Count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments. Defendant's father makes statements. Defendant's mother makes statements. Defendant makes statements.  

Court orders the following:
COUNT #1:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3.5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
-	18 months of Initial Confinement
-	18 months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Term of Probation:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
All prescriptions need to be filled at the same pharmacy.
All treating physicians are to be informed of these charges.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Comply with any family court orders.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 90 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.

Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 2 years, if all conditions are met and agent deems appropriate.
